pr_body:
Tarantool uses SQL VM with conventional interpretation technique: 
loop over instruction, inside which dispatching switch-case executes logic of current opcode.

In switch-based interpreter each instruction requires two jumps:
1. one indirect jump to the branch handling the current instruction
2. one direct jump from there to the main loop.

It would be better to avoid the second one, by jumping directly to the code handling the next instruction. 
This is called threaded code.

To measure the percentage of time spent in the VDBE in switch-based technique
and threaded code technique a query with recursion was used:

```sql
WITH RECURSIVE temp (n, sum) AS
(SELECT 0, 0
UNION ALL
SELECT n+1, (n+1)+sum FROM temp
WHERE n < 1000000)
SELECT * FROM temp;
```

**The percentage of time spent in the VDBE**

* switch-based technique: ~83%

* threaded code technique: ~76%

Closes #4212
